definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: standard, ensign, signal, sign (NH id., flag, usu. sign, i.e. miracle; Targum [[נֵס]], [[נִסָּא]] sign, miracle);—´[[נ]] abs. Nu 21:8 +; cstr. Is 11:10; sf. [[נִסִּי]] Ex 17:15, Is 49:22; —

definitions.title: 1. a.
definitions.body: standard, as rallying-point, [[נִסִּי]] ´[[י]] Ex 17:15 (E), ´[[י]] my standard (name of altar); conspicuously set on hill Is 30:17 (sim. of solitariness; ‖[[תּׂרֶן עַל־ראׁשׁ הָהָר]]); signal of war [v. Schumacher:ZPV ix. 232, Across the Jordan, 104 f.] (esp. to the nations, for destruction or deliverance of Judah, Is Je), [[לַגּוֹיִם]] ´[[נׇשָׂא נ]] Is 5:26, Is 11:12 cf. Is 18:3 (on mts., ‖[[תָּקַע שׁוֹפָר]]); [[אֶל־עַמִּים]] ´[[אָרִים נ]] Is 49:22 (‖[[אֶשָּׂא אֶל־גּוֹיִם יׇדִי]]),—in all these subj. ´[[י]]; cf. [[עׂמֵד לְנֵס עַמִּים]] Is 10:11 (of Mess. kg.); ´[[שְׂאוּ נ]] Is 13:2 (on mt.), Je 50:2, Je 51:12 (c. [[אֶל־]] against), v:Je 51:27 (‖[[תִּקְעוּ שׁוֹפָר בַּגּוֹיִם]]), [[עַל־עַמִּים]] ´[[הָרִימוּ נ]] Is 62:10, cf. Je 4:21 (‖[[קוֹל שׁוֹפָר]]); [[לְהִתְנוֹסֵס]] ´[[נ]]…[[נׇתַתָּה]] Ps 60:6 thou hast set a standard (only) for fleeing.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: signal, [[חִיּ֫וֹנׇה]] ´[[שְׂאוּ נ]] Je 4:6 (i.e. to direct refugees to Zion).
standard, as pole, supporting serpent of bronze Nu 21:8, Nu 21:9 (JE).

definitions.title: 3. a.
definitions.body: ensign, signal, [[מִמִּחְרַיִם הָיׇה מִפְרָשֵׁח לִהְיוֹת לָח לְנֵס]]…[[שֵׁשׁ]] Ez Eze 27:7 byssus from Egypt was thy sail, to serve thee for an ensign (so DaToy; on lack of pennon on ancient ships v. Co; > del. Co Berthol); so

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: (since sails were the only ensign) = sail Is 33:23 (Che Di al.; > pennon Ges Hi Ew De Du).
